question: Which word means to make certain that something will occur or be the case?
Which word means causing great and irreparable damage?
What term refers to long-term shifts in global or regional climate patterns?
Which word means relating to or affecting the entire planet?
Which word means the state of having lost too much water from the body?
Which word means the process of turning from liquid into vapor?
Which word refers to a large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply?
Which word means to interrupt or cause disorder to an event, activity, or process?
Which word refers to grains used for food, such as wheat, rice, or corn?
Which word means a main or important element of something, especially of a diet?
Which word means to predict or prophesy a future event?
Which word means the rate at which something occurs over a particular period of time?
Which phrase means on the verge of something, typically something bad or disastrous?
Which word means an extreme scarcity of food?
Which word means a first or preliminary version of a device from which other forms are developed?
Which word means able to withstand prolonged periods of dry weather?
Which word means to produce or provide a natural, agricultural, or industrial product?
Which word means next to or along with someone or something else?
Which word means to become dry and shriveled, typically due to lack of water?
Which word means the supply of water to land or crops to help growth, typically by means of channels?
Which word is a unit of measurement for liquid capacity equal to 4 quarts or 3.785 liters?
Which word means land covered with grass and other low plants suitable for grazing animals?
Which word means too poor to produce much or any vegetation?
Which word means feeling or showing anxiety or discontent?
Which word means not securely held or in position; dangerously likely to fall or collapse?
Which word means a secret plan by a group to do something unlawful or harmful?
Which phrase means for the sake of or in honor of someone or something?
Which word means a government authority or license conferring a right or title for a set period, especially the sole right to make, use, or sell an invention?
Which word means to make something appear larger than it is, especially with a lens or microscope?
Which word means to cause an animal to produce offspring, typically in a controlled and organized way?
Which word means an important assignment carried out for political, religious, or commercial purposes, typically involving travel?
Which word means the force that attracts a body toward the center of the earth or toward any other physical body having mass?
Which phrase means to be at risk or in danger of being lost or damaged?
Which word means the desire to do something, especially something wrong or unwise?
Which word means a detailed analysis and assessment of something, especially a literary, philosophical, or political theory?
Which phrase means to mistake one person or thing for another?
Which word means to give a misleading or false account or impression of something?
Which word refers to a comparison between two things, typically for the purpose of explanation or clarification?
Which word means to pay no attention to or ignore something?
Which word means giving good value or service in relation to the amount of money, time, or effort spent?
Which word refers to a careful examination or scrutiny of something?
Which word means providing useful or interesting information?
Which word refers to an abstract idea or general notion?
Which word means having great influence on someone or something?
Which word means careful to avoid potential problems or dangers?
Which phrase means in the opposite order or direction?
Which word means to produce or discharge something, especially gas, radiation, heat, or light?
Which word refers to a lack of consensus or approval?
Which phrase means to talk or converse with someone in a friendly and informal way?
